clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of Lacosamide in Pediatric Patients With Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: International Multicenter, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of Lacosamide in the Treatment of Pediatric Patients With Focal Refractory Epilepsy.

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Children with focal refractory epilepsy will be routinely included in the collection of history, blood routine, biochemistry, EEG, MRI and 18F-FDG PET to determine the location of the epileptogenic focus and to assess the severity of the disease. This international multicenter clinical trial uses a double-blind, randomized, controlled study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of LCM in clinical applications in children with epilepsy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: The reduction of absolute number of weekly seizures in the 16-week treatment period compared with the retrospective baseline period

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of liver function by serum alanine aminotransferase (U/L)
primary_outcome.description: The serum alanine aminotransferase (blood biochemistry) will be performed at baseline, at the 3rd and 6th visits to monitor the liver function of patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of renal function by serum creatinine (umol/L)
primary_outcome.description: The serum creatinine (blood biochemistry) will be performed at baseline, at the 3rd and 6th visits to monitor the renal function of patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of white blood cell count ( /L)
primary_outcome.description: The white blood cell count (blood routine) will be performed at baseline, at the 3rd and 6th visits to monitor the renal function of patients.

intervention.description: The experimental group will be given oral lacosamide supplementation on the basis of the original antiepileptic drugs.
The control group will be given oral placebo supplementation on the basis of the original antiepileptic drugs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of focal epilepsy with or without generalized seizures according to the 2017 International Association of Anti-Epilepsy (ILAE) classification criteria.
- Stable taking 1 or 2 other first-line anti-epileptic drugs for at least 10 weeks before screening visits.
- Seizure occurred during the 8-week retrospective baseline period with a complete medical record diary.
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of status epilepticus within 3 months prior to screening visits.
- Poor adherence to previous treatment.
- Other serious organic diseases, mental illnesses and neurological diseases.
- Abnormal liver and kidney function and blood routine results.
